intro: Mespilodaphne sprucei, commonly known as the Himalayan mespilodaphne, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the eastern Himalayas, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a drupe, typically containing a single seed, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
